Plačali so aro, a pristali na cesti
Martina Rudel in Žan Javornik že preselila svoje stvari, nato se je najemodajalka premislila. V Slovenskih Konjicah je posredovala tudi policija.
01 Nov 2019, 11:45 by Mojca Marot



Martina Rudel pravi, da je doživela zelo slabo izkušnjo z najemodajalko, saj je ostala brez želenega stanovanja.



Žan Javornik FOTO: FB



Stanovanje sta hotela najeti v Slovenskih Konjicah. FOTO: wikipedia


CELJE, SLOVENSKE KONJICE – »Doživela sem še eno zelo neprijetno izkušnjo, tokrat se je ta primerila moji celotni družini, nanjo pa opozarjam zato, da se ne bo še kdo opekel, kot smo se mi,« je zapis na družabnem omrežju začela Celjanka Martina Rudel, sicer mama dveh otrok, ki je od decembra lani živela v Štorah v najetem stanovanju, velikem 37 kvadratnih metrov, skupaj s partnerjem Žanom Javornikom in psom. »Za nas je bilo dovolj prostora, a je prišlo v sorodstvu do neke osebne stvari, o kateri javno ne bi govorila, zato bi bila selitev v večje stanovanje ali hišo nujna,« je še razkrila Rudlova in začela s partnerjem Žanom še istega dne pregledovati tovrstne ponudbe za najem večjega stanovanja. Našla sta ga, pogoj je seveda bil, da imajo lahko v njem tudi psa.


Žan Javornik FOTO: FB

Premislila si je
»Stanovanje sva našla v Slovenskih Konjicah in z lastnico smo se dogovorili, da ga pridemo pogledat,« nam je dejal Javornik. Martini in Žanu je bilo všeč, lastnici sta rekla, da bi vse skupaj še prespala in naslednji dan sporočila, kako sta se odločila. In odločila sta se, da ga bosta najela. Lastnico sta poklicala, dogovorili so se za najemnino v višini 420 evrov in varščino v enakem znesku, kar naj bi zneslo 840 evrov. Z lastnico, gre za Polono Dobnik Dubovski, sicer priznano izredno profesorico na mariborski fakulteti za strojništvo, sta se dogovorila, da sestavi pogodbo, ki naj bi bila podpisana v ponedeljek, 2. septembra, ara je znašala 100 evrov. Rudlova si je oddahnila, da imajo spet streho nad glavo, še pred podpisom pogodbe sta v bodoče najemniško stanovanje po dogovoru z lastnico z Žanom lahko odpeljala že nekaj stvari, saj sta prejšnje stanovanje v Štorah že izpraznila.
100 evrov je znašalo predplačilo.
A v četrtek prejšnji teden ju je lastnica stanovanja po njunih besedah poklicala in povedala, da si je premislila in jima stanovanja ne bo oddala v najem, zato naj prideta po stvari. »Kljub moledovanju, naj tega ne stori, ker bomo brez strehe nad glavo, je vztrajala pri svojem. Ko sva hotela vedeti, čemu takšen preobrat, je rekla, da se to naju ne tiče,« je še povedal Žan. Časa, da odpeljejo stvari, ki so jih že pripeljali, so imeli dva dni, ponje so se odpravili s kombijem, Rudlova ​je s seboj vzela še mamo Tejo, da bi jim pomagala. Tu pa se zgodba še bolj zaplete. »V Slovenske Konjice smo prispeli okoli 19. ure, pet minut zatem je prišla najemodajalka z enim delavcem in rekla, naj hitro spakiramo stvari, ker da se ji mudi naprej. Prva sem šla v hišo jaz, da bi videla, ali so vse stvari na enem mestu, in videla, da jih je iz zgornjega premaknila v spodnje prostore,« pripoveduje Martina.Medtem ko je pregledovala stvari, naj bi v stanovanje vstopila tudi njena mama in Žan, da bi ji pomagala, a naj bi se najemodajalka po besedah Rudlove do mame vedla nesramno in žaljivo: »Zagrabila jo je in potisnila v kombi, češ da nima v njeni hiši kaj iskati, čeprav je mama stala le med vhodnimi vrati.«Najemodajalka naj bi odrinila tudi Žana, Martina pa ga je prosila, naj pokliče policiste. »Poklical jih je tudi delavec najemodajalke in so prišli. Povedali smo, kaj se je dogajalo, in nato ob njihovi navzočnosti odnesli stvari v kombi, na policijski postaji v Slovenskih Konjicah pa smo sestavili zapisnik o dogajanju, saj je Martinina mama dobila odrgnino in imela poškodovano rebro, ker jo je najemodajalka potisnila v kombi,« nam pove Žan Javornik. Da se to ne bi zgodilo še komu, so zgodbo razširili po družabnem omrežju.
Preverjanje najemnikov
Seveda smo poklicali Polono Dobnik Dubovski, a je bila redkobesedna. »Jaz lahko na vse to rečem le, da se sonce vrti okoli zemlje,« je dejala. In dodala, da bodo vsa nesoglasja, do katerih je prišlo, urejale za to pristojne institucije. Pravi, da je razočarana, kako lahko nekdo po omrežjih in tudi medijih širi nepreverjeno zgodbo, saj se ve, da ima vsaka vedno dve plati. In da nje ni poklical nihče razen nas, seveda pa je logično, da vsak najemodajalec preverja potencialne najemnike, saj ni vseeno, koga dobiš v hišo. In neuradno naj bi se najemniki sprva predstavljali v povsem drugačni luči.


Stanovanje sta hotela najeti v Slovenskih Konjicah. FOTO: wikipedia

Nenavadno pa je, da so morali prejšnje najeto stanovanje v Štorah izprazniti v le dveh dneh, saj mora imeti vsak na voljo najmanj enomesečni odpovedni rok. Ko smo o tem še enkrat vprašali Martino, je ponovila, da je imela najeto zasebno stanovanje, razlog za odhod pa je bil oseben. »V primeru Slovenskih Konjic sem šla na zaupanje in prejšnje stanovanje sem vrnila, ko smo podpisali za aro. No, zdaj vidim, da preden pogodba ni podpisana, ne moreš verjeti nikomur,« pravi Rudlova, ki se je selila že nekajkrat, od tega dvakrat v podnajemniško stanovanje. In to predvsem zaradi nosečnosti in prostorske stiske z nekdanjim partnerjem, s katerim sta bila tudi pri njegovih in njenih starših.

They paid the aroma but landed on the road
Martina Rudel and Jean Javornik had already moved their things, then the landlord changed her mind. The police also intervened in Slovenske Konjice.
01 Nov 2019, 11:45 by Mojca Marot



Martina Rudel says she experienced a very poor landlord experience as she was left without a desired apartment.



Jean Javornik PHOTO: FB



They wanted to rent an apartment in Slovenske Konjice. PHOTO: wikipedia


CELJE, SLOVENIAN HORSES - "I had another very unpleasant experience, this time it was the same for my entire family, and I am warning it so that no one else will get burned like us," Celjanka Martin wrote on social network Rudel, the mother of two children, has lived in a rented apartment measuring 37 square meters in Store since December last year, with partner Jean Javornik and a dog. "There was enough space for us, but there was some personal affair that I wouldn't talk about publicly, so moving to a bigger apartment or house would be necessary," Rudlova revealed, and began to check with partner Jean the same day. such offers for renting a larger apartment. They found him, the condition, of course, was that they could have a dog in him as well.


Jean Javornik PHOTO: FB

She changed her mind
"We found the apartment in Slovenske Konjice and we agreed with the owner to come and see it," Javornik told us. Martini and Jean liked it, and the owners said that they would sleep all over again and let them know the next day. And they decided to hire him. They called the landlord, they agreed on a $ 420 rent and a bail equal to $ 840. With the owner, this is Polona Dobnik Dubovski, an otherwise recognized associate professor at the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering in Maribor, and they agreed to draw up a contract, which was to be signed on Monday, September 2, with an amount of $ 100. Rudlova was relieved that they had a roof over their heads again, and even before signing the contract, they had already been able to take some things to the future rental flat with the owner and Jean, as they had already vacated the previous apartment in Štore.
$ 100 was an advance.
But on Thursday last week, the owner of the apartment called them and said that she had changed her mind and would not rent them out, so let them get things done. “Despite her pleading not to do it, because we will be homeless, she insisted on her own. When we wanted to know what the turnaround was, she said it wasn't our concern, "Jean said. They had two days to get the things they had already brought, they had left with a van, Rudlova took her mother Teja with her to help them. This is where the story gets even more complicated. “We arrived at Slovenske Konjice around 7 pm, five minutes later a landlord with one worker came in and told us to pack things quickly because she was in a hurry. I went to the house first to see if all the things were in one place and to see that she had moved them from the upper to the lower rooms, "says Martina. While she was inspecting things, her mother was supposed to enter the apartment as well. and Jean to help her, but according to Rudl, the landlord seemed rude and abusive to her mother: "She grabbed her and pushed her into the van, saying that she had nothing to look for in her house, even though her mother was standing just outside the front door. «The landlord also allegedly ousted Jean and asked Martin to call the police. “They were also called by a landlord worker and they came. We told what was going on and then, in their presence, took things to the van, and at the police station in Slovenske Konjice we made a record of the events, as Martina's mother got a bruise and had a broken rib because the landlord pushed her into the van. "Jean Javornik tells us. To prevent this from happening to anyone else, they have spread the story on social media.
Checking tenants
Of course we called Polona Dobnik Dubovski, but it was rare. "All I can say is that the sun is revolving around the earth," she said. She added that all the disagreements that had arisen would be settled by the competent institutions. She says she is disappointed that someone can spread an untested story across networks and the media, knowing that each one always has two sides. And that she was not called by anyone but us, but of course it makes sense for every landlord to check on potential tenants, because it doesn't matter who you get into the house. And unofficially, the tenants were initially supposed to present themselves in a completely different light.


They wanted to rent an apartment in Slovenske Konjice. PHOTO: wikipedia

It is strange, however, that the previous rented apartment in Štore had to be vacated in just two days, since everyone must have at least one month's notice. When we asked Martina about it again, she repeated that she had rented a private apartment and the reason for leaving was personal. “In the case of Slovenske Konjice, I went to the trust and returned the previous apartment when we signed for the ara. Well, now I see that before the contract is signed, you can't trust anyone, "says Rudlova, who has moved several times, twice to a rented apartment. This was mainly due to the pregnancy and the physical distress with his former partner, who he and his parents were with.
